question.text:
Match list-I (Fundamental Experiment) with List-II (its conclusion) and select the correct option from the choices given below the list:
 
   List-I    List-II
A Franck-Hertz Experiment (i) Particle nature of light
B Photo-electric experiment (ii) Discrete energy levels of the atom
C Davison-Germer Experiment (iii) Wave nature of electron
    (iv) Structure of atom

options.text: <math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>-</mo><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>)</mo></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>-</mo><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>)</mo></math>

<math><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi></mrow></mfenced><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi><mo>-</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">v</mi></mrow></mfenced><mo>;</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mo>-</mo><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mo>)</mo></math>

solution.text: Frank-Hertz's experiment demonstrated the existence of excited states in mercury atoms helping to confirm the quantum theory which predicted that electrons occupied only discrete quantized energy states. The photo-electric experiment demonstrated that photon is the particle of light, which can transfer momentum and energy due to collision. Davidson-Germer's experiment shows the wave nature of electrons.
